* The main class for the Amos task management application.

*

This class handles initializing the storage, task list, and user interface,
* processing user commands in a loop, and delegating tasks to the appropriate
* methods such as adding, marking, unmarking, or deleting tasks.

* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and provides a more specific

* Represents the base exception class for all custom exceptions in Amos.
* This class extends {@link Exception} and can be used as a parent for more
* specific exception types within the Amos application.
* Returns a string representation of this exception.
* @return A fixed error message indicating that an error occurred.
return "Sry, there might have error somewhere!";
* Represents an exception that occurs when there is an error related to
* the input file in the Amos application.
* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and provides a specific
* error message to indicate problems with file input or processing.
* Returns a string representation of this exception with a message
* indicating that there was an error in the input file.
* @return A detailed error message describing the file-related issue.
return String.format("%s \n\t There's some error in your input file.",
* Represents an exception that occurs when attempting to mark or unmark

* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and indicates that the
* Whether the exception was caused by attempting to mark a task.

* Returns a string representation of this exception with a message
* indicating whether the error was caused by marking or unmarking
* a task that was already in the same state.

return String.format("%s \n\t Opps! This has already been marked",
return String.format("%s \n\t Opps! This has already been unmarked",
* Represents an exception that occurs when there is an error related to
* a specific task in the Amos application.
* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and indicates that the
* provided task input may be invalid or incorrectly formatted.
* The name or type of the task that caused the exception.
* @param task The task name or type that triggered this exception.
* Returns a string representation of this exception with a message
* prompting the user to recheck the provided task input.
* @return A detailed error message describing the task-related issue.
return String.format("%s \n\t Please check your input for the %s again!",
* Represents an exception thrown when an event or task has an invalid time range
* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and indicates that the end time
* of a task occurs before its start time.
* Returns a string representation of this exception with a message
* informing the user that the end time must be after the start time.
* @return A detailed error message about the invalid time range.
return String.format("%s \n\t End time must be after the start time!",
* Represents an exception thrown when a specified task cannot be found
* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and indicates that the
* user attempted to access or modify a task that does not exist.
* Returns a string representation of this exception with a message
* informing the user that the requested task could not be found.
* @return A detailed error message about the unfound task.
return String.format("%s \n\t Cannot find such task! PLS check your input again.",
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an unknown or unsupported
* command is encountered in the Amos application.
* This exception extends {@link AmosException} and indicates that the
* user has entered a command that the system does not recognize.
* The unrecognized command entered by the user.
* @param command The unknown command string that caused this exception.
* Returns a string representation of this exception with a message
* informing the user that the entered command is not recognized.
* @return A detailed error message describing the unknown command issue.
return String.format("%s \n\t I have never seen the command '%s' before! PLS try again.",
* Handles loading and saving tasks from/to a file.
